title: Slow Cooker Baby Back Ribs Recipe
description: Slow cooker ribs cooked in a crockpot until tender, then coated with your favorite barbeque sauce for fall off the bone, lip-smacking ribs every time.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe:¬†Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Meat and Poultry Pork Pork Rib Recipes Baby Back Ribs Slow Cooker Baby Back Ribs 4.8 (1,350) 1,019 Reviews 175 Photos These slow cooker ribs are the best ‚Äî they turn out perfect every time! They cook in a crockpot until tender, then are covered with barbeque sauce and finished in the oven for fall-apart ribs. Perfect for during the week as the slow cooker does most of the work! Submitted by norah Updated on October 11, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 175 175 175 175 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 4 hrs 15 mins Total Time: 4 hrs 25 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 3 pounds baby back ribs, trimmed salt and ground black pepper, to taste ¬Ω cup water ¬Ω onion, sliced 1 clove garlic, minced 1 (18 ounce) bottle barbeque sauce Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Season ribs with salt and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour 1/2 cup water into the slow cooker, then add ribs. Scatter onion and garlic over top. Cover and cook on Low for 8 hours or High for 4 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios When the ribs are almost finished, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Transfer ribs from the slow cooker to a baking sheet; discard onion and garlic. Coat ribs with barbeque sauce. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake ribs in the preheated oven until sauce caramelizes and sticks to meat, 10 to 15 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Editor's Note Discover the best slow cookers to buy for making our favorite slow cooker recipes. More About This Recipe: This slow cooker ribs recipe will quickly become your favorite set-it-and-forget-it meal. The tender, fall-off-the bone meat is a surefire crowd-pleaser.¬† How to Cook Ribs In the Slow Cooker You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe above, but let's go over the basics: Slow Cooker Ribs Ingredients These are the ingredients you‚Äôll need for this Crock-Pot baby back ribs recipe:¬† Ribs: For about six servings, you‚Äôll need three pounds of trimmed baby back ribs.¬† Seasonings: The ribs are simply seasoned with salt and pepper.¬† Water: You‚Äôll need about ¬Ω cup of water.¬† Onion¬†and¬†garlic: Sliced onion and minced garlic lend bold flavor.¬† Barbecue sauce: Use store-bought or¬†homemade barbecue sauce.¬† How to Make Slow Cooker Baby Back Ribs Here‚Äôs a brief overview of what you can expect when you make baby back ribs in the slow cooker:¬† Add all the ingredients (besides the sauce) to the slow cooker.¬†Cook on Low for 8 hours or High for 4 hours.¬†Coat the ribs with sauce and bake until the sauce caramelizes.¬† What to Serve With Slow Cooker Ribs Explore our collection of¬†Delicious Side Dishes for Ribs¬†for delicious serving inspiration. Here are a few of the mouth watering ideas you‚Äôll find:¬† Corn Fritters¬† Grandma's Collard Greens¬† Southern Dill Potato Salad How to Store Slow Cooker Ribs Store your cooked slow cooker baby back rib leftovers in an airtight container or wrap them tightly in storage wrap or aluminum foil. They'll last for up to four days in the refrigerator. Reheat in the microwave or on the stove. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise ‚ÄúThis is an easy recipe if you're a novice in the kitchen or just in a hurry,‚Äù according to¬†Karen L Turk. ‚ÄúSet it up before you go to work and finish when you get home.‚Äù ‚ÄúBest ribs we have ever had,‚Äù raves¬†Christine Zyontz. ‚ÄúWhat an amazing, simple recipe! I cut them into four pieces before cooking. They were in the slow cooker for 8 hours on low and were fall-off-the-bone and so moist.‚Äù ‚ÄúEasy and fantastic results,‚Äù says¬†wayne chadwick. ‚ÄúMeat falls off the bone ... instead of water, you can use just about any liquid you want. I have done this with beer, root beer, cranberry wine.‚Äù Editorial contributions by Corey Williams.¬† I Made It Print 3,482 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Slow Cooker Baby Back Ribs 01 of 175 Photo by¬† Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 175 Photo by¬† Brian 03/22/2025 Family favorite This is the 3rd time I have made this. Fall off the bone ribs. I used homemade BBQ sauce as well. Delicious. 03 of 175 Photo by¬† nikkioliver 10/02/2024 Super simple and super flavor! I've made these at least 10 times, using whatever liquid I have on hand (apple juice, pineapple juice, or beer are favs). Family of six, eveyone loves them and we never have leftovers. 04 of 175 Photo by¬† GoldenGrape4119 06/30/2024 I had never done ribs before this recipe and now I've done them at least 4 times. Officially addicted. I used a Santa Maria Rub I found and added a touch of tequila with the water and onions instead of bbq sauce and my husband raved how good they were. Said for me not to change a thing and that they were the best ribs he's ever had. I had tried for 20 years to get that kind of reaction from him, so thank you for this recipe. It only takes about 4 hrs to cook and then I put them in the oven for 30 minutes just for good measure. Melts in your mouth delectably. 05 of 175 Photo by¬† ProudTray1602 02/05/2024 It‚Äôs really good 06 of 175 Photo by¬† Rob685 09/23/2023 First time making ribs this way. Always made them slow in the oven would definitely do it this way in the future.Cooked on high for 3-1/2 hours then finished them off sauced in the air fryer for 8 minutes on 375 Perfect.üëç 07 of 175 Photo by¬† RubyBread4580 11/22/2022 Turned out great!! First time I tried this recipe I cooked them on high for 4 hrs. The ribs turned out great and were falling off the bone, but shrunk a bit. Just made them again on low for 8 hrs. Again, just as tender, falling off the bone, but ribs kept their shape. I'll definitely continue using this recipe. Enjoy!! 08 of 175 Photo by¬† Christine Zyontz 10/19/2022 Best ribs we have ever had. What an amazing, simple recipe! I cut them into four pieces before cooking. They were in the slow cooker for 8 hours on low and were fall-off-the-bone and so moist. Definitely will be part of our rotation. Good enough to impress company. 09 of 175 Photo by¬† Vickie Jones Hendren 08/14/2022 10 of 175 Photo by¬† LoftyHen2221 07/03/2022 Very easy to make, tasted fantastic! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Instant Pot Baby Back Ribs 237 Ratings Slow-Cooker Barbecue Ribs 2,161 Ratings Baby Back Ribs, Smoked to Perfection Air Fryer BBQ Baby Back Ribs 30 Ratings Chef John's Copycat McRib Sandwich 34 Ratings Instant Pot¬Æ Sweet Baby Back Ribs 14 Ratings Fall-off-the-Bone Instant Pot Ribs 123 Ratings Slow Cooked Ribs 6 Ratings Slow-Cooker Teriyaki Ribs 14 Ratings Easy Instant Pot Baby Back Ribs 4 Ratings Maple Glazed Ribs 216 Ratings Amazing Ribs 328 Ratings Slow Cooker BBQ Rib Tips 2 Ratings 3-Ingredient BBQ Pulled Pork 55 Ratings Prize-Winning Baby Back Ribs 751 Ratings CCRyder's Cider-Smoked Ribs 6 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family.
